intro: Cuphocarpus inermis, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers and red, fleshy fruits. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its fruit is edible, though it has a sour taste, and is used in local cuisines. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in harsh conditions.
